common

Class SequentialByteReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.AbstractByteReader
      • common.SequentialByteReader

  • public class SequentialByteReader
extends AbstractByteReader
    Performs sequential reading of primitive data types from a byte array.

    Supports reading of signed and unsigned integers, floating-point numbers, and byte sequences with configurable byte order (big-endian or little-endian).

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

      Constructs a reader for the given byte array with big-endian byte order.
      SequentialByteReader(byte[] buf, java.nio.ByteOrder order)
      Constructs a reader for the given byte array with a specified byte order.
      SequentialByteReader(byte[] buf, long offset)
      Constructs a reader for the given byte array, starting from a specified offset.
      SequentialByteReader(byte[] buf, long offset, java.nio.ByteOrder order)
      Constructs a reader for the given byte array, starting from the specified offset in specified byte order.

      • skip

        public long skip(long n)
        Skips forward by the specified number of bytes.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of bytes to skip
        Returns:
        the new position after skipping
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if skipping would exceed the buffer bounds

      • seek

        public void seek(long pos)
        Moves to the specified position within the byte array.
        Parameters:
        pos - the position to move to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the position is invalid

      • mark

        public void mark()
        Marks the current position in the buffer, allowing a subsequent reset() call to return to this position.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the reader's position to the last marked position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the mark stack is empty

      • readString

        public java.lang.String readString()
        Reads a null-terminated Latin-1 (ISO-8859-1) encoded string from the current position.

        The null terminator is consumed but not included in the returned string.

        Returns:
        the decoded string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a null terminator is not found before the end of the buffer

      • readValue

        private int readValue(int numBytes)
        Reads a signed integer of the specified byte length.
        Parameters:
        numBytes - number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        the integer value
